item.description:
Take a hike along a wild stretch of New Hampshire's coastline!

...Hampton Beach? ...Wild? YES, that's right!

 There's a state park at the southern end of Hampton Beach with huge dunes and miles of sand. Maybe you never noticed it because of the large parking lot in front that in summer is filled with cars and RVs. BUT, there are large dunes and a very wide, sandy beach behind that now-empty lot.

AND Hampton in the off-season is a pleasant seaside town without the large crowds, loud motorcycles, and ill-considered tatoos you might find in the summer. They recently rebuilt the bandstand and bathhouse area, making it very attractive. AND IT"S GOING TO REACH 60 DEGREES again on SUNDAY!!

Come take a walk along this wild stretch of New Hampshire's coastline on a quiet, sunny Sunday, and stroll through what you will see is a very nice beach town. You'll never think of Hampton Beach in quite the same way again!

Of course, we'll also stop in town for fish & chips or a burger, and a beer. The weather is going to be very WARM and SUNNY - a perfect day for a walk on the beach!

Location: Hampton Beach State Park is at the very south end of town, ocean side, just north of the causeway bridge. Parking is ample and free in March.

CARPOOLS: Post a comment if you want to  share a ride. I will meet you in Hampton.

Portsmouth Carpool: 10:30am. Portsmouth Bus Station - 185 Grafton Ave. There are two parking lots. Meet in the back of the overflow lot - the lot farthest from the main bus terminal building, farther up Grafton Ave - at the very back of the lot.

Newburyport Carpool: 10:30am. C&J Bus lot, 90 Storey Ave/Rt 113 at I-95.

No pets.
Liability Release: AS A CONDITION OF ATTENDING THIS MEETUP, YOU AGREE TO hold harmless, and indemnify the organizer and his heirs, and all members and participants of the Seacoast Outdoors Meetup group from any and all claims for injury, illness, death, and/or property damage including those caused by negligence, ignorance, inexperience and other reasons. You also agree to assume all mental, physical, financial, and/or other risk associated with this meetup. Kayaking, camping, hiking, bicycling, snow sports, alcohol consumption, and other activities pose inherent risks and dangers. Participation in these activities is voluntary and dependent upon your own personal judgment.
Time and location are subject to change due to weather and other factors.  Always check email & this listing for updates before leaving home.
item.name: Sunny Sunday Beach Hike & Burger!
